meanings.definition: A mouthpart of certain invertebrates used for feeding.
meanings.sent1: The hypostomes of the insects help them eat their food.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hypostomes of the tiny creatures under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The hypostomes of the ants were so tiny, they looked like little straws for drinking.
meanings.sent4: The hypostomes of the mosquito pierced the skin like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: The hypostomes of the butterfly were like tiny tubes for sipping nectar.

meanings.definition: The oral opening of a hydra or other cnidarian.
meanings.sent1: The hydra extended its hypostomes to catch its prey in the water.
meanings.sent2: The biologist observed the movement of the hypostomes in the cnidarian.
meanings.sent3: The hypostomes of the jellyfish wiggled like tiny fingers trying to grab something.
meanings.sent4: The hypostomes of the sea anemone swayed gently in the ocean currents.
meanings.sent5: The hypostomes of the coral polyp were colorful and fascinating to watch.
